thread.title: Gang member known as 'Big Evil' charged in 'unprovoked, senseless' Rainier Valley murder
thread.title_full: Gang member known as 'Big Evil' charged in 'unprovoked, senseless' Rainier Valley murder - seattlepi.com

author: LYNSI BURTON, SEATTLEPI.COM STAFF
title: Gang member known as 'Big Evil' charged in 'unprovoked, senseless' Rainier Valley murder
text:
A 34-year-old known gang member was charged Friday with the "unprovoked and senseless" slaying of a 20-year-old man Sunday in the Brighton area of Rainier Valley.
Michael David Henderson, whose moniker is "Big Evil," is accused of second-degree murder and illegal firearm possession and remains held in King County Jail on $2 million bail.
Surveillance footage shows Henderson arguing with 20-year-old Abubakar Abdi Sunday night, then pulling out a gun and shooting him before walking away with friends.
Multiple witnesses pinned the shooting on Henderson.
Police were called to Rainier Avenue South and South Garden street about 11:36 p.m. Cops and medics found Abdi dead of a gunshot wound, court records say.
Witness reports indicate a minor argument arose between Abdi and Henderson across the street from the shooting scene at a Shell gas station. The pair did not know each other.
Abdi and his friends moved across the street, and Henderson and two friends followed, reports indicate. Henderson and Abdi exchanged more words until Henderson drew a firearm and shot Abdi before walking away, according to court documents.
Abdi's friends tried to revive him, to no avail.
Witnesses said no threats were exchanged, and no weapons were drawn during the verbal argument until Henderson fired the fatal shot.
Surveillance video and witness reports led investigators to Henderson, who was on probation from a previous vehicular assault conviction. Officers found him Wednesday night and took him into custody.
